sentences: Sina aga paistad muutuvat mugavaks v채ikekodanlaseks, m천ttelaisaks ja kompromissidele minejaks.
Ta ei paista t채helepanu sellele probleemile.
Meie paistame k천ik oma tegevustes edukad.
context: The word 'paistad' is the second person singular form of the Estonian verb 'paistma', which means to shine, appear, or seem. In the given context from L. Metsar's work, it is used to suggest that someone appears to be becoming a comfortable petty bourgeois person who is thoughtless and willing to compromise.
